data.title: George A. Grosvenor
data.text:
Year Inducted: 1980

Nominated By: B. Ernest Watkins

Sports Competed In: Basketball, Football, Track

Athlete, Coach or Contributor: Athlete, Coach

High School:

Attended Boulder Prep, graduating in 1929.

Achievements:

High School:

● Earned nine letters playing three sports (Football, Basketball and Track).

● Team's quarterback from 1926-28, played forward on the basketball team and was a member of the track team.(1927-29).

College:

Went to the University of Colorado (CU), graduated in 1934.

Achievements:

College:

● Three-year letterman in both football at quarterback (1929-33) and a forward on the Buffaloes basketball team (1930-34).

● Member of the CU track team for two seasons.

● Twice earned All-Conference selection as quarterback for the Buffaloes.

Related Activities:

Played pro football for four years with the Chicago Cardinals (1934-37).

Coaching Career:

● Head football and track coach (1938-42) as well as basketball coach (1939-42) for Pueblo Centennial H.S.

● Led the basketball team to the state championship in 1940 recording an undefeated season and the football team to a runner-up finish at state in 1939.

Occupations:

● Hired as a teacher and coach Centennial H.S. (1938-42).

● Spent 30 years as Superintendent of Steel Production at the C.F.&I.

● Worked as a consultant at Monterey Mexico for fund Dora Steel for three and a half years.
